image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton shake hands at an election leaders' debate

props.synopsis: Polite in tone, there was no shortage of accusations of lying as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton met for the first of the federal election leaders' debates.

title.children: Dutton, Albanese dub each other liars in first election debate

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton shake hands.

props.synopsis: Both the prime minister and the opposition leader hit their marks in the first debate but the opposition leader was under more pressure to perform after a truly horrendous week.

title.children: Debate has not reversed a nightmare week for Dutton, despite his best efforts

image.altText: Donald trump standing in front of the american flag

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump's tariffs continue to roil financial markets, economists say the risk for Australia is if the economy of China, the nation's largest trading partner, is damaged by the trade war.

title.children: Economist warns Australia could be 'sucked into recession' amid global downturn

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping. Both are wearing a blue suit, blue tie and have a neutral facial expression.

props.synopsis: The US president has taken to social media to say he is confident Beijing will call as a 104 per cent tariff deadline looms.

title.children: Trump says he is 'waiting' for China's call as tariff deadline looms

image.altText: Elon Musk sits in the Oval Office wearing a red baseball cap that says: "Trump was right about everything"

props.synopsis: Elon Musk calls Donald Trump's top trade adviser a "moron", escalating tensions over tariffs within the US president's inner sanctum, as some White House officials indicate deals could be on the table.

title.children: Musk calls Trump adviser 'dumber than bricks' as tariff blowback escalates

image.altText: A four-year-old boy wearing shorts and a t-shirt sits on the grass with a broad smile on his face.

props.synopsis: The mother of a boy who is Deafblind is frustrated after being told her son wouldn't have the one-on-one assistance he needs to understand lessons in his preferred setting.

title.children: Parents 'confused and baffled' by school inclusion policies

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk stand together at Trump's inauguration

props.synopsis: Trump's tariffs have caused the stock market to crash to levels not seen since the COVID-19 pandemic, and billionaires are feeling the sting.

title.children: Who was hit the hardest? Billionaires lose out as stock market crashes

image.altText: JD Vance speaking at a lectern, a close up photo of him.

props.synopsis: The US vice president's comments have been widely circulated on Chinese social media and received a sharp rebuke from Beijing.

title.children: JD Vance called 'ignorant and impolite' by China over 'peasants' remark

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy wearing a black top and standing emotionless alongside a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: In a post on the encrypted messaging service Telegram, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claims to have information about "significantly more Chinese citizens" serving in Russian military units, and says he's ordered his foreign minister to contact Beijing.

title.children: Chinese soldiers captured fighting alongside Russians in Ukraine, says Zelenskyy

image.altText: A two-storey guard tower sits behind rows of barbed-wire fences running along the border between North Korea and South Korea.

props.synopsis: The latest confrontation comes after months of increased tensions between the neighbouring countries.

title.children: South Korean army fires warning shots at armed North Korean troops

image.altText: A sick boy looks up at the camera from his hospital bed

props.synopsis: The Netanyahu Government announced it would block all supplies entering Gaza to pressure Hamas at the beginning of March, but doctors argue its women and children feeling the impact most.

title.children: Six weeks into a humanitarian aid blockade of Gaza, doctors are running out of medicine

image.altText: a male politician standing at a lectern

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's father suffered a medical episode just hours before the Opposition Leader faced off against Anthony Albanese in the first leaders' debate of the election campaign.

title.children: Dutton's father suffered medical episode hours before first leaders debate

image.altText: Rescue workers seen from across the road sifting through a collapsed nightclub.

props.synopsis: At least 27 people have died and more than 134 people injured after a roof fell at Jet Set nightclub in the Dominican Republic.

title.children: At least 27 dead, more than 134 injured in roof collapse at Dominican Republic nightclub

image.altText: prince harry

props.synopsis: Prince Harry's attorney has told court judges he was treated "unfairly" when he was stripped of his British security detail.

title.children: Prince Harry treated 'unfairly' over British security detail, lawyer tells court

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's cornerstone east coast gas reservation policy may reduce household electricity bills by "around 3 per cent" in 2026, according to modelling released nearly two weeks after the plan was announced.

title.children: Peter Dutton's gas 'diversion' plan to lower household energy bills by 3 per cent

image.altText: A screenshot of a map of Sydney with gold highlighted areas on different suburbs.

props.synopsis: Property developers and home owners alike in NSW are cashing in after new planning laws to help build hundreds of thousands of apartments came into effect in February.

title.children: 'Biggest single change' to Sydney planning rules sees house prices soar

image.altText: A girl wearing a headscarf sits on a motel bed and smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Eleven-year-old Waslat and her family are among a growing number of Afghan refugees facing an uncertain future as a housing crisis grips Melbourne's outer south-east.

title.children: In the midst of a housing crisis, refugees struggle to find a home

image.altText: A young Amanda Knox, with long brown hair, is led into a room by a female police officer

props.synopsis: Amanda Knox reflects on 18 years of public opinion, our favourite Parks and Recreation characters reunite, and a son tries to pull his dad out of a conspiracy rabbit hole in the best podcasts this month.

title.children: How do you cope with being wrongfully, and publicly, convicted of murder?

image.altText: A graphic showing Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton imposed onto a red and blue background

props.synopsis: Australia is at the pointy end of a mental health crisis. Here's what the major parties are offering at the election and what the experts think of those promises.

title.children: The differences between Labor and the Coalition's mental health policies

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a business shirt smiles while posing for a portrait.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party's replacement for its dumped candidate in the NSW seat of Whitlam is a director of a pro-gas group accused of misleading voters ahead of next month's federal election.

title.children: Replacement Liberal candidate a director of 'misleading' pro-gas group

image.altText: Leah O'Brien smiles after winning the 100m at the Australian under-18 track and field championships.

props.synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Leah O'Brien has set a new Australian under-18 100m record, breaking Raelene Boyle's mark set at the 1968 Mexico City Olympics.

title.children: Perth teen breaks Australian 100m record that stood for 57 years

image.altText: A male hanging his arms and head out of a Toyota Hilux car window

props.synopsis: The video posted to social media shows a man throwing what appears to be the body of a dead dingo into a car's path, before it is driven over.

title.children: 'Disgusting' video of group defiling dead animal sparks outrage

image.altText: A car backing out of a disability parking space.

props.synopsis: Queensland Youth Justice Minister Laura Gerber has conceded a car she travelled in to a press conference should not have stopped in a disability parking bay, with a retired Paralympian saying the elected official's error is disappointing to see.

title.children: Advocate 'disappointed' politician's car used a disability parking spot

image.altText: A man holds an umbrella in front of his face while getting into a car

props.synopsis: An NT school staffer has been granted bail after allegedly having sex with a student and sending her "persistent requests for photos" via Instagram.

title.children: NT school staffer's Instagram messages aired in student sex case

image.altText: A Colossal Biosciences press photo of a two genetically modified 'dire wolf' pups at three months old

props.synopsis: A US startup claims to have brought an extinct species back into existence. It's prompted debate about the difference of resurrecting an extinct species and genetically modifying an existing one.

title.children: Heard about the return of the dire wolf? Here's why you should be skeptical

image.altText: Three women standing together.

props.synopsis: For residents of Altadena, hopes of rebuilding their community just as it was are facing mounting challenges.

title.children: Their house burned down in the LA fires. Then the predatory phone calls started

image.altText: Runners cross the finish line on a blue athletics running track at night.

props.synopsis: The handicaps for the historic Stawell Gift have been announced, with Lachlan Kennedy the backmark in the men's race with Gout Gout just ahead.

title.children: Gout Gout, Lachlan Kennedy to resume rivalry 75cm apart at Stawell Gift

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for an ADFA cadet accused of raping a colleague tell an ACT Supreme Court jury it must decide if the woman was pressured into consent or made a complaint because she regretted the encounter.

title.children: Jury hears ADFA cadet accused of raping colleague 'wasn't asking'

image.altText: Seth

props.synopsis: Members of Australia's biggest superannuation fund say they asked about a key safeguard against online fraud before cyber thieves stole retirement savings.

title.children: Customers asked super fund about security weakness before cyberattacks

image.altText: An aerial shot of a town surrounded by water

props.synopsis: The NSW State Emergency Service is responding to ongoing flooding as flows from Queensland cause river rises to pass historic levels.

title.children: Residents isolated as record flooding hits western NSW

image.altText: Paul Marsh

props.synopsis: Outgoing AFLPA chief Paul Marsh is proud of the developments in the mental health space at AFL clubs but warns the scrutiny on players is only growing.

title.children: Mental health still footballers' big issue, says outgoing AFLPA boss

props.synopsis: Paris Tier, the partner of GWS defender Conor Stone, found herself in her GP’s office asking to go on Ozempic after receiving online hate comments about her weight.

title.children: AFL partners divulge ‘lifelong body dysmorphia’ from online trolling

image.altText: A metal sign that says "Armidale Secondary College".

props.synopsis: The woman will serve her sentence in the community after the court heard a lifelong distrust of police and concern for her daughter contributed to her verbal clash with police at a NSW high school.

title.children: Mother jailed on same day as school lockdown outburst wins appeal

image.altText: Composite image of six smiling women.

props.synopsis: Deep in Queensland's blue-blood heartland, six female independent candidates are aiming to dismantle decades of an LNP stranglehold on power.

title.children: Six teals fighting against history, safe seats to change Qld politics
